I have tried the following three scenarios when specifying login form items=
 to the crawler:

USER -> myUserID
PASSWORD -> myPassword

"USER" -> myUser=
ID
"PASSWORD" -> myPassword

"USER" -> "myUserID"
"PASSWORD" -> "myPassword=
"

All three fail with the following SEVERE alert message...

Setting attri=
bute value null on /crawl-order/credential-store/credentials/HTML_FORM/form=
-items/USER: Value of illegal type: 'null', 'java.lang.String' was expected=
.

Has anyone experienced this kind of issue when playing with form based a=
uthentication?

I actually even manually edited the order.xml file in the c=
urrent job folder that is created right before i click the submit button wi=
th the following.

<map name=3D"form-items">
            <string name=3D"US=
ER" value=3D"myUserID">myUserID</string>
            <string name=3D"PASSWO=
RD" value=3D"myPassword">myPassword</string>
          </map>

Once i click=
 submit, the heritrix crawler drops the value attributes that I manually ad=
ded and then once again alerts me with-> Setting attribute value null on /c=
rawl-order/credential-store/credentials/HTML_FORM/form-items/USER: Value of=
 illegal type: 'null', 'java.lang.String' was expected. 

Thanks!
